chunk.textFormat: In this course we have gone through

Course content (overview)
Course objectives
Torque tightening in a correct way
Angle tightening
Applying silicon
Adjusting of engine brake
Screw tightening order
Oil filter change
Engine harness and connectors
Fuel filter change
Bleeding of the fuel system
Control of a turbo charger
Replace the coolant filter
Coolant pump control
Drive belt

The last part of the course begins with a short gathering and an opportunity to ask questions.
Go through the course summary, what has been covered.
Ask for "first impressions", any questions, anything unclear etc.
Hand out and ask students to fill in course evaluation. This should take about 20 minutes to complete. Inform the participants that they can remain anonymous if they like but if anyone has any comments their signature would be appreciated, although not absolutely necessary.
Finish off by thanking the participants for the interest they have shown and where appropriate, hand out their mechanic's passes, diplomas or presents.

The course evaluation form is meant to give the training instructor an idea of how the participants regard the training instructor and the course, and how things in the training process could be improved.
